text: Oh sure, the plot was totally groundbreaking… not.
Wow, the plot was totally unpredictable and kept me guessing… amazing!
I just love it when characters make the most obvious decisions ever.
I love how the characters’ decisions are clever and keep the story moving.
Yeah, I totally needed another 2-hour montage of people staring at walls.
I was captivated by the quiet, reflective moments—they added so much depth.
Absolutely loved the ending—if confusion is what you were going for.
Absolutely loved the ending—it tied everything together perfectly.
Wow, the soundtrack really enhanced that totally forgettable scene.
Wow, the soundtrack really enhanced the emotional impact of every scene.
I really appreciated the deep philosophical dialogue between two cardboard cutouts.
I really appreciated the thoughtful dialogue that made the story richer.
Oh, the twists were so shocking, I didn’t see the obvious coming… at all.
Oh, the twists were so shocking, I couldn’t predict them at all!
I adore a good villain who literally explains their entire plan in one sentence.
I adore a clever villain whose motivations are revealed subtly and brilliantly.
Sure, the cinematography was stunning… if you like watching paint dry.
Sure, the cinematography was stunning… every frame felt cinematic.
Loved every second of that incredibly fast-paced slow-motion chase.
Loved every second of that perfectly-paced action sequence.
I couldn’t stop laughing at how seriously they took that totally unfunny joke.
I couldn’t stop laughing at the brilliantly timed, clever jokes.
Yes, let’s have a 10-minute monologue about absolutely nothing important.
Yes, the monologue revealed essential backstory and developed the characters.
The characters’ chemistry was explosive… if by explosive you mean non-existent.
The characters’ chemistry was explosive… their interactions were unforgettable.
Oh yeah, nothing says emotional depth like staring blankly into the horizon for 5 minutes.
Oh yeah, the emotional depth came through beautifully in the characters’ reflective moments.
I loved the suspense, especially the part where literally nothing happened.
I loved the suspense; every moment was tense and unpredictable.
The plot development was so subtle, I didn’t even notice it exist.
The plot development was subtle, yet extremely satisfying.
The dialogue really made me feel something… mostly my regret.
The dialogue really made me feel something—it was heartfelt and real.
Wow, what a masterpiece… in the sense that I can’t believe they made it.
Wow, what a masterpiece; the storytelling was flawless.
Oh yes, I definitely needed another inspirational speech about nothing.
Oh yes, the inspirational speech added so much to the story.
